alert.note: Alert for Fisher (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 21 at 10:31PM CDT until June 21 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Fisher County in west central Texas... * Until 1100 PM CDT. * At 1030 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 7 miles north of Rotan, moving south at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and hail up to three inches in diameter. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Rotan around 1040 PM CDT. Hobbs around 1045 PM CDT. Roby around 1055 PM CDT. Longworth and Sylvester around 1100 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Busby, Capitola and Us-180 Near The Fisher-Scurry County Line. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...3.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
